area_name: Main Wall (aka The Gorilla Head Buttress)

content.description: Wounded Eagle combines technical strength, balance and superior mind control all into one spectacular climb. Sporty Bouldery moves for 35' will get you to the last crux, "The Step Across", improbable iron cross move left will get you to the Gray Streak. Climb the Gray Streak 5.8 to top.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches. Protection is decent but precise and micro through the cruxes. Same anchor as Tatanka, giant slung boulder at top right of crag.
content.location: Wounded Eagle climbs the farthest right margin of the Main Wall. Climb the large rounded blunt arete just left of Tatanka. Follow shallow obtuse corner with the black and orange streaks until you have gained the large potato chip shaped flake. Now make this step across move left to gain the gray streak.

content.description: Tatanka Direct climbs the same start as Tatanka, instead of working your way up left at the visor roof pull directly through splitter roof crack in center!
content.protection: Gear to 4 inches. Gear anchor to 3 inches.

climbs.name: Tatanka
climbs.fa: Jonathan Reinig, John Reinig, Josh Reinig.

content.description: One of the Easier routes at Old Castle. From far right side of Central Ledge, climb up and right 30 feet through grassy, blocky, 5.0 terrain. This will put you directly under the right slabs of the Gorilla Head Buttress. Climb either very large grassy right facing corner, or better yet climb broken cracked feature 15 feet right of corner to large visor roof. Pull the roof on left side in the corner via awkward body slot groove. Now climb directly up vertical yet protectable face 25' to belay station at top of buttress.
content.protection: Many slung constrictions. Gear up to 3 inches. Giant slung Boulder at top of climb for belay anchor.
content.location: Tatanka is found at the extreme far right margin of the main wall obvious low angle slabs capped by roof.

content.description:
Samsara Roof is the classic Old Castle roof crack test piece.

Boulder problem off of central ledge gets you into this stellar overhanging finger crack. The crux is definitely pulling the lip of roof but another ankle busting crux occurs after roof, pulling into Conception.
content.protection: Gear to 2", double finger sized pieces. Conception Anchor.
content.location: Obvious splitter roof crack starting off middle left of Central Ledge.

climbs.name: Bodhisattva Arête
climbs.fa: Joshua Reinig, John Reinig, Jonathan Reinig, Chris Norwood.

content.description:
One of the best Arêtes around. The Bodhisattva is the most obvious, inspiring, proudest, line that exists at Old Castle. The whole route is pretty sustained and steep, starting out at 5.10 and continually getting more difficult toward the top around 11b.

The crux comes at the last sequence as you crank off the hold Dubbed "The Shark Tooth", to a grim V6 Move to Jugs. Blow it here on lead and you will take the 30 footer of your life, as your last good pro is a solid 15 feet below you. :)
content.location: The Bodhisattva Arête is the large blunt arête that makes up the left skyline of the main wall. Start in either bird shit covered chimney, fun 5.7. Even better overhanging bulge just left of bird shit chimney start, 10a, to small triangular stance. Now Dyno sideways 10 feet clearing chimney gap to arête!!! Climb left side of arête to obvious right facing arch. Here it becomes possible to obtain the boulder problem head-wall finish and last place for gear!!!

content.description: On my solo ascent of this superb line is when I received a phone call from my wife mid route, that we were having a child. Having done the climb hundreds of times over the course of 10 years and never having named it, this name stuck. CONCEPTION! One of the most classic lines at Old Castle crag, if not one of the most classic in San Diego. Conception climbs the striking double finger crack straight up the center head wall of the Gorilla Head Buttress. It is as sustained as it looks from the ground. With significant crux being the transition from the starting dihedral into the double finger cracks.
content.protection:
One old bolt protects first crux. Gear to 2 inches. Doubles in micro from 0-.5!

Old school bomber chain with pitons. Back up anchor with gear sizes .4-2 inches.
content.location: Starts right side of the Central Ledge. Climb obvious right facing corner with old bolt to small triangular roof, 25'. Exit roof on the left side to access beautiful splitter double finger crack to top.

content.description: With excellent positioning pulling the roof on the right wall. Lightening Bear has a stiff Bouldery Crux. Once You have pulled through the overhang you have gained the Grey Streak, climb the left-hand margin of the grey streak to the top 5.9.
content.protection: Would be a great sport route but no bolts currently exist, top rope via giant slung boulder.
content.location: Starts at far right margin of Central Ledge. Climb birdshit covered pillar to Bouldery brownish roof. 15' left of Wounded Eagle. 5 feet right of Thunder Bunny.

climbs.name: Thunder Bunny
climbs.fa: Erik Williams, Paul Russell, Jace Mullen.

content.description: One of the better sport climbs in north county, Thunder Bunny climbs continuous bulges via technical crimps, slopers and side pulls.  Pretty sustained definitely get the stances you need to make each clip.
content.protection:
8 bolts, anchor either to large slung boulder or chains atop Conception.

Stick clip is nice.
content.location: Starts at far right end of the Central Ledge. Climb up out of alcove 4 feet right of start to Conception, 4' left of bird shit covered pillar start of Lightening Bear.

pathTokens: Main Wall (aka The Gorilla Head Buttress)
